stories.title: What American universities can learn from Germany (2016)

stories.text:
How to read a (non fiction)book in the most effective way? I've found a skimming technique which is quite effective. Technique: Read First Para and then read first sentence of subsequent para until you find a concluding para. (Note: Assumption is to be made with reading every first sentence of what's happening in the paragraphs) What I found hard is to find a concluding para Any ideas to share? What do you think about this type of skimming? Is there a better and effective way?

P.S: How to take notes? I've highlighted important points. Is copying the highlights as it is to the notes or refer it and curate it into our own understanding?
stories.title: How to Read Effectively?
Decomposing Shopify’s Rails Monolith with Kirsten Westeinde

stories.text:
Is this considered OK. I want to use email address such as `me@mylastname.xyz`

I already purchased the domain. I'm only asking if I can run into some issues where my email would be considered spam since I've read somewhere that bunch of spam emails come from .xyz TLD domains.

The reason why I'm getting .xyz and not .com is because someone with same last name already has .com but I still want to use something recognizable.
stories.title: Using xyz TLD domain as a primary email address
Taco Bell to Reinvent Drive-Thru Concept with Futuristic Restaurant
Frontpage – Terms of Service; Didn't Read
